newsitem.title: SPAIN: FORECAST - One-year bill yields seen stable on Wed.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST - One-year bill yields seen stable on Wed.

text.p: The yield on Spanish one-year Treasury bills at Wednesday's auction is expected to be little changed from 5.579 percent at the previous auction on March 19, dealers said on Tuesday.
Dealers said they expected the yield to be set within a range of 5.55 to 5.60 percent, in line with grey-market rates, with the auction exciting little investor interest.
"There are no expectations for changes, money market rates and grey-market rates are stable. I guess bids will be made at the same levels," said one dealer.
Yields on Treasury bills bottomed in February, coinciding with peseta exchange rate tension.

Although February inflation fell to a fresh low of 2.5 percent year-on-year, providing room for a rate cut at the following Bank of Spain repo auction, peseta tension and reduced prospects for further rate cuts in the future mean that lower T-bill and interbank rates are more difficult, dealers said.
Dealers are expecting bids of between 350 and 450 billion pesetas. On Friday April 4, 464.9 billion pesetas of one-year bills will mature.
